      • SendData

        public void SendData(BluetoothSocket s,
                     int type,
                     JSONObject payload)
        Core bluetooth functionality for the phone sending data
        Parameters:
        s - - a bluetooth socket created previously by doPair
        type - - The purpose of this sending, so that the receiver will process data corectly
        payload - - the actual data being sent

      • encryptOffer

        public JSONObject encryptOffer(byte[] senderPublicKey,
                               byte[] senderPrivateKey,
                               byte[] receiverPublicKey,
                               JSONObject offer)
        Core use of PGPainless to encrypt an offer with PGP
        Parameters:
        senderPublicKey - - Alice's Public Key
        senderPrivateKey - - Alice's Private Key
        receiverPublicKey - - Bob's Public Key
        offer - - Alice's offer to Bob
        Returns:
        A JSONobject representation of the encrypted offer

      • decryptOffer

        public JSONObject decryptOffer(byte[] senderPublicKey,
                               byte[] receiverPublicKey,
                               byte[] receiverPrivateKey,
                               java.lang.String encrypted)
        Core use of PGPainless to decrypt an offer.
        Parameters:
        senderPublicKey - - Alice's Public Key
        receiverPublicKey - - Bob's Public Key
        receiverPrivateKey - - Bob's Private Key
        encrypted - - Alice's encrypted offer to bob
        Returns:
        A JSONObject that represents the decrypted offer TODO: Make the verifications visible to the user

      • signOffer

        public java.lang.String signOffer(byte[] privateKey,
                                  byte[] cipher)
        Core use of PGPainless to sign an offer encrypted by someone else.
        Parameters:
        privateKey - - Bob's private key
        cipher - - Alice's encrypted offer
        Returns:
        A string of Alice's Encrypted offer appended with Bob's signature

      • validateCSRF

        public void validateCSRF(java.lang.String token,
                         java.lang.String jwt,
                         java.lang.String cookie,
                         View v,
                         RequestQueue rq)
        A manual testing function of the HTTP login methods, not actually required for user Confirms that the login response received from back-end is actually valid
        Parameters:
        token - - XSRF Token from HTTP response header
        jwt - - JWT Token from HTTP response body
        cookie - - XSRF Cookie from HTTP response body
        v - - Where to show test results
        rq - - Where to send the HTTP request

      • submitHandshake

        public void submitHandshake(java.lang.String token,
                            java.lang.String jwt,
                            java.lang.String cookie,
                            java.lang.String receiver,
                            java.lang.String title,
                            java.lang.String encrypted,
                            RequestQueue rq)
        Core usage of Volley to report finalized Handshake to backend
        Parameters:
        token - - XSRF Token from HTTP response header
        jwt - - JWT Token from HTTP response body
        cookie - - XSRF Cookie from HTTP response body
        receiver - - UserID of the other person in this handshake
        title - - Plaintext name for this handshake
        encrypted - - The encrypted details that will be stored by the backend
        rq - - Where to send the HTTP request
